TopicTitle: So how do I download the update?

Articles.Content:
I have not done an update of KSP before, I bought the game just a few weeks ago.

I first tried running Launcher.x86, but it still shows "Checking for Updates" after 10 minutes.

I tried running Patcher, but is is not recognised as an executable file.

I tried going to [https://www.kerbalspaceprogram.com/download.php](https://www.kerbalspaceprogram.com/download.php), but it no longer exists.

I tried to go to my account page, but it is nowhere to be found on the website.

Am I missing something? How do I get this glorious update?
go to the purchase section of the ksp website to log in
Thank you, found it. A direct link from the home page to log in (or when already logged in, to my account) would have been very useful.
I'm using windows but none of these methods work for me either, could i have a link to the purchases section?

I went to [https://kerbalspaceprogram.com/kspstore/index.php?p=22](https://kerbalspaceprogram.com/kspstore/index.php?p=22) (Purchase KSP Now!), logged in, then [https://kerbalspaceprogram.com/profile.php?userProf=info](https://kerbalspaceprogram.com/profile.php?userProf=info) (My Account) and then [https://kerbalspaceprogram.com/download.php?od=296979](https://kerbalspaceprogram.com/download.php?od=296979) (Download). Hope that helps you.

Nope, all those addresses still show 'server migration'

WHY do a server migration on patch day?
Yeah, the page is still down for me.
The server is up, can you try clearing your cache and restarting the browser?
If you can see the home page at [https://kerbalspaceprogram.com/en/](https://kerbalspaceprogram.com/en/), from there you can go to Purchase, log in, My Account and Download.

I'm not at localhost, the server is up and so is the store, migration ended half an hour ago at least, but if your DNS cache is not pointing to the site it will fail.

That image is of the new site, the old site was very different.

[**There's info here on clearing the cache in several browsers**](http://kb.siteground.com/how_to_clear_cache_in_firefox_internetexplorer_safari_opera/), also try restarting the browser.

I'm fully capable of doing this, it has been done. 

server is still migrating

Hmm, might have to force another DNS server, there's [**some info here on doing this on Linux**](http://www.rackspace.com/knowledge_center/article/changing-dns-settings-on-linux), I'm using Google DNS currently which is 8.8.8.8 and 8.8.4.4, those may work for you.

Cheers mate, changing the name server fixed it.
